intro: Coutoubea alba, commonly known as the white coutoubea, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Brazil. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its showy, white, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in spring. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters, with dense, evergreen foliage. Its roots are adapted to acidic soils, and it thrives in moist, shaded environments. Coutoubea alba is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to attract pollinators.
